alert.note: Alert for Buchanan (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 2:58PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Buchanan and western McDowell Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 257 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Glen Burke, or 9 miles east of Grundy, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... War, Bradshaw, Iaeger, Avondale, Jolo and Oakwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground.
